activities: Bertelsmann, Inc.'s reporting systems provide a process for employees and others to report misconduct and violations of the company's Code of Conduct.  Personal data collected in these systems may include names and descriptions of the alleged employee misconduct. Other personal data is transmitted as part of ethics and compliance training of employees.

recoursemech: To ensure compliance with the Safe Harbor Principles, the Organization will: (a) cooperate with the Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) of the EU countries (and/or Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC)) in the investigation and resolution of complaints and comply with advice given by DPAs; (b) periodically review and verify the company’s compliance with the Safe Harbor Principles; and (c) remedy issues arising out of any failure to comply with the Safe Harbor Principles.
